docs.title: ChangeLog
docs.text: This page tracks major updates and release notes for MegaClassify documentation and setup guidance.

docs.title: v1.0.0
docs.text:
• Initial documentation portal setup using MkDocs Material
  • Structured setup guides for Admin, Mobile, and Web apps
  • Added troubleshooting for common deployment issues
  • Added support and FAQ pages

For product package-specific release notes, check the changelog/documentation included in your CodeCanyon ZIP.

docs.title: Do I only need this website to install MegaClassify?
docs.text: No. You must also read and follow the documentation included inside the CodeCanyon ZIP package delivered with your purchase.

docs.title: I completed installation but get a 500 error. What should I check?
docs.text:
• Confirm .env values are valid
  • Check PHP version and required extensions
  • Verify file permissions for storage/ and bootstrap/cache/
  • Run cache clear commands:
php artisan optimize:clear

docs.title: Uploaded images are not visible.
docs.text:
Most commonly, the storage symlink is missing. Run:

php artisan storage:link

docs.title: Mobile/Web app cannot connect to API.
docs.text:
• Check API base URL is correct (https://apimega.megzed.com format)
  • Validate CORS configuration in backend
  • Confirm SSL certificate is valid
  • Ensure no firewall blocks API routes

docs.title: Database migration failed on production.
docs.text:
Use safe migration command:

php artisan migrate --force

Also ensure database credentials and privileges are correct.

docs.title: Support
docs.text: Need help with MegaClassify setup or troubleshooting?

docs.title: Contact Support
docs.text:
• Email: megaclassify@gmail.com
  • WhatsApp: 7032202023

docs.title: Before Contacting Support
docs.text:
Please prepare:

  • Purchase code / buyer details (masked if needed)
  • Current version/build number
  • Server environment details (OS, PHP, DB, web server)
  • Exact error message and screenshot
  • Relevant logs (storage/logs/laravel.log, web server logs)

docs.title: Common Fast Checks
docs.text:
1. Reconfirm all installation steps were followed
  2. Verify .env values
  3. Re-run:
php artisan optimize:clear
php artisan storage:link
  1. Confirm permissions on writable folders
  2. Review the CodeCanyon bundled documentation

docs.title: Support Scope
docs.text:
Support generally covers:

  • Installation guidance
  • Configuration clarification
  • Bug diagnosis and known fixes

Customization and third-party infrastructure tuning may require additional effort.

docs.title: Setup Admin Panel - Configuration
docs.text: After installation, finalize production-safe configuration.

docs.title: 1) Essential .env Configuration
docs.text:
Review and tune:

  • APP_ENV=production
  • APP_DEBUG=false
  • APP_URL=https://{{YOUR_DOMAIN}}
  • DB credentials
  • Mail credentials
  • Queue/session/cache drivers

Never commit real .env values to Git.

docs.title: 2) Queue & Cron (Recommended)
docs.text:
For better performance, configure worker/cron if package requires background jobs.

Typical scheduler cron:

* * * * * cd /home/{{CPANEL_USER}}/{{APP_PATH}} && php artisan schedule:run >> /dev/null 2>&1

docs.title: 3) Web Server Best Practices (Apache/Nginx)
docs.text:
• Enforce HTTPS
  • Enable gzip/brotli (if available)
  • Add reasonable client upload size for listing media
  • Block direct access to sensitive files (.env, .git)

Sample location protection snippet:

location ~ /\.(env|git) {
    deny all;
}

docs.title: 4) CORS/API Considerations
docs.text:
If mobile or web app cannot call API:

  • Confirm APP_URL and API base URL are correct
  • Configure allowed origins in CORS settings
  • Ensure OPTIONS preflight requests are handled
  • Validate SSL and intermediate certificates

docs.title: 5) File Permission Policy
docs.text:
Writable paths:

  • storage/
  • bootstrap/cache/

Use least-privilege settings and avoid world writable permissions.

docs.title: HTTP 500 Error
docs.text:
1. Check Laravel log:
tail -n 200 storage/logs/laravel.log
  1. Check Apache/Nginx error logs from cPanel (Metrics/Errors or domain logs)
  2. Validate PHP version/extensions
  3. Re-run:
php artisan optimize:clear

docs.title: Storage Link Issue (Images Not Loading)
docs.text:
php artisan storage:link

Ensure public/storage points to storage/app/public.

docs.title: CORS Errors
docs.text:
• Verify frontend origin is allowed
  • Clear config cache:
php artisan optimize:clear
  • Confirm reverse proxy is not stripping headers

docs.title: Permission Denied Errors
docs.text:
find /home/{{CPANEL_USER}}/{{APP_PATH}} -type f -exec chmod 644 {} \;
find /home/{{CPANEL_USER}}/{{APP_PATH}} -type d -exec chmod 755 {} \;
chmod -R 775 storage bootstrap/cache

docs.title: Migration Issues
docs.text:
php artisan migrate --force

Confirm DB user privileges (ALTER, CREATE, INDEX, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE).

docs.title: 7) Backup & Update Policy
docs.text:
Before each update:

  • Backup database
  • Backup .env
  • Backup uploaded media (storage/app/public)

After update:

composer install --no-dev -o
php artisan migrate --force
php artisan optimize:clear

docs.title: Setup Admin Panel - Installation Steps
docs.text:
This is the primary production installation flow for cPanel-based hosting.

Warning

Keep this guide aligned with the documentation bundled in your CodeCanyon ZIP. If package docs and this page differ by version, follow the package-specific instructions first.

docs.title: 1) Upload Project Files
docs.text:
• Open cPanel → File Manager
  • Create app folder, e.g. /home/{{CPANEL_USER}}/{{APP_PATH}}
  • Upload and extract project files from CodeCanyon package
  • Confirm Laravel files exist (artisan, app/, public/, vendor/ after Composer install)

docs.title: 2) Set Public Web Root
docs.text:
Point your domain/subdomain document root to Laravel public folder.

Example:

  • App root: /home/{{CPANEL_USER}}/{{APP_PATH}}
  • Web root: /home/{{CPANEL_USER}}/{{APP_PATH}}/public

For cPanel subdomains/addon domains, adjust document root in Domains settings.

docs.title: 3) Create Database from cPanel
docs.text:
In MySQL® Databases:

  • Create database: {{DB_NAME}}
  • Create database user: {{DB_USER}}
  • Set strong password
  • Add user to database with ALL PRIVILEGES

docs.title: 4) Install PHP Dependencies
docs.text:
Run from project root (SSH/Terminal):

composer install --no-dev -o

docs.title: 5) Environment Setup
docs.text:
cp .env.example .env

Edit .env with real values:

APP_NAME=MegaClassify
APP_ENV=production
APP_KEY=
APP_DEBUG=false
APP_URL=https://{{YOUR_DOMAIN}}

DB_CONNECTION=mysql
DB_HOST=127.0.0.1
DB_PORT=3306
DB_DATABASE={{DB_NAME}}
DB_USERNAME={{DB_USER}}
DB_PASSWORD={{DB_PASSWORD}}

CACHE_DRIVER=file
QUEUE_CONNECTION=sync
SESSION_DRIVER=file

docs.title: 6) Generate App Key
docs.text: php artisan key:generate

docs.title: 7) Run Migrations
docs.text: php artisan migrate --force

docs.title: 8) Create Storage Symlink
docs.text: php artisan storage:link

docs.title: 9) Clear/Optimize Cached Artifacts
docs.text: php artisan optimize:clear

docs.title: 10) Apply Final Permissions
docs.text:
find /home/{{CPANEL_USER}}/{{APP_PATH}} -type f -exec chmod 644 {} \;
find /home/{{CPANEL_USER}}/{{APP_PATH}} -type d -exec chmod 755 {} \;
chmod -R 775 /home/{{CPANEL_USER}}/{{APP_PATH}}/storage
chmod -R 775 /home/{{CPANEL_USER}}/{{APP_PATH}}/bootstrap/cache

docs.title: 11) SSL Enablement
docs.text:
In cPanel:

  • Open SSL/TLS Status
  • Run AutoSSL (or install custom certificate)
  • Force HTTPS from domain settings / redirect rules

docs.title: 12) Buyer Verification Checklist (Install Gate)
docs.text:
• [ ] Purchase code confirmed
  • [ ] Buyer details match CodeCanyon account
  • [ ] Package source is official download
  • [ ] No nulled/modified core package used
  • [ ] All required setup files from ZIP preserved

docs.title: 13) Post-Install Smoke Test
docs.text:
• Open https://{{YOUR_DOMAIN}}
  • Verify homepage and login load
  • Login to admin user
  • Create test category/listing
  • Upload a test image
  • Confirm image visible in frontend/admin

docs.title: Setup Admin Panel - Prerequisite
docs.text:
Need a Faster Launch? We Can Help With Setup

Use the steps below for self-installation, or proceed directly to guided setup assistance.

Get Started

The Admin Panel is the core of MegaClassify. Complete these requirements before installation.

CodeCanyon Buyers

You must use this online guide together with the documentation included inside your CodeCanyon ZIP package.

docs.title: 1) Server Requirements
docs.text:
Recommended production stack:

  • Linux (Ubuntu 20.04+/AlmaLinux/RockyLinux)
  • cPanel/WHM access (or equivalent hosting control panel)
  • Nginx (recommended) or Apache
  • PHP 8.1+ with required extensions
  • MySQL 5.7+ or MariaDB 10.4+
  • Composer 2.x
  • Node.js (if frontend assets need rebuild)
  • Valid SSL certificate

docs.title: 2) Required PHP Extensions
docs.text:
Enable common Laravel extensions:

  • bcmath
  • ctype
  • fileinfo
  • json
  • mbstring
  • openssl
  • pdo
  • pdo_mysql
  • tokenizer
  • xml
  • curl
  • zip
  • gd

docs.title: 3) Domain & DNS
docs.text:
Prepare:

  • Admin domain/subdomain (example: admin.example.com)
  • API endpoint domain if separated
  • DNS A record pointing to server IP
  • SSL certificate issuance readiness (AutoSSL/Let's Encrypt in cPanel)

docs.title: 4) Database Preparation
docs.text:
Create a dedicated database and user:

  • Database Name: {{DB_NAME}}
  • Username: {{DB_USER}}
  • Password: {{DB_PASSWORD}}
  • Host: 127.0.0.1 (or managed DB host)

Grant full privileges for this DB user on the created DB.

docs.title: 5) Buyer Verification Checklist (Pre-Install)
docs.text:
• [ ] Valid purchase code available
  • [ ] CodeCanyon buyer account details verified
  • [ ] CodeCanyon ZIP downloaded and extracted
  • [ ] Included offline documentation reviewed
  • [ ] Deployment target domain ready

docs.title: 6) Folder Ownership & Permissions Strategy
docs.text:
For cPanel hosting, keep Laravel writable directories accessible to the account user and web server process:

find /home/{{CPANEL_USER}}/{{APP_PATH}} -type f -exec chmod 644 {} \;
find /home/{{CPANEL_USER}}/{{APP_PATH}} -type d -exec chmod 755 {} \;
chmod -R 775 /home/{{CPANEL_USER}}/{{APP_PATH}}/storage
chmod -R 775 /home/{{CPANEL_USER}}/{{APP_PATH}}/bootstrap/cache

Avoid 777 in production.

docs.title: Setup Mobile Application - Prerequisite
docs.text: Prepare the following before building the MegaClassify mobile app.

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• Latest project source from official package
  • Android Studio / Xcode (depending on target platform)
  • Supported Flutter/React Native stack (based on packaged source)
  • API base URL from deployed backend
  • Valid signing credentials/keystore for release builds

docs.title: Configuration Inputs
docs.text:
• API_BASE_URL=https://apimega.megzed.com
  • App name, bundle ID/package name
  • Push notification keys (if enabled)

docs.title: Buyer Checklist
docs.text:
• [ ] Purchased and downloaded official CodeCanyon package
  • [ ] Reviewed included mobile setup guide in ZIP
  • [ ] Confirmed backend API is live before app testing

docs.title: Setup Mobile Application - Setup & Build
docs.text: Follow your package-specific mobile framework guide first, then use these general steps.

docs.title: 1) Connect to API
docs.text:
Set API endpoint to your deployed backend:

  • Example: https://apimega.megzed.com

docs.title: 2) Install Dependencies
docs.text: Use the command set required by shipped framework (Flutter/React Native/etc.).

docs.title: 3) Configure Environment/Constants
docs.text:
Update:

  • Base URL
  • App identifiers
  • Feature flags
  • Payment/notification keys (if any)

docs.title: 4) Build App
docs.text: Generate debug build first, then release build using your signing config.

docs.title: CORS / API Network Failures
docs.text:
• Verify backend CORS allows mobile origin or wildcard policy as needed
  • Check SSL validity and TLS compatibility
  • Confirm API path/version matches mobile code expectations

docs.title: Authentication Fails
docs.text:
• Check API URL and auth endpoints
  • Validate server time/timezone
  • Verify credentials and token configuration

docs.title: 1) Configure Environment (React/Vite)
docs.text:
Set production values in your frontend environment file (example: .env.production):

VITE_APP_NAME=MegaClassify
VITE_API_BASE_URL=https://apimega.megzed.com

Also configure branding keys and analytics IDs if your build uses them.

docs.title: 2) Install and Build (React/Vite)
docs.text:
From web source directory:

npm install
npm run build

Build output is typically generated in dist/.

docs.title: 3) Deploy Build Output to Web Server
docs.text:
• Upload dist/ contents to your frontend domain document root
  • If hosted in cPanel, use File Manager or Git deployment
  • Configure SPA fallback so unknown routes return index.html
  • Ensure HTTPS is enabled

docs.title: Nginx SPA Fallback Example
docs.text:
location / {
  try_files $uri $uri/ /index.html;
}

docs.title: Apache (.htaccess) SPA Fallback Example
docs.text:
<IfModule mod_rewrite.c>
  RewriteEngine On
  RewriteBase /
  RewriteRule ^index\.html$ - [L]
  RewriteCond %{REQUEST_FILENAME} !-f
  RewriteCond %{REQUEST_FILENAME} !-d
  RewriteRule . /index.html [L]
</IfModule>

docs.title: 4) Post-Deploy Validation
docs.text:
• Open homepage and listing pages
  • Verify login/register actions
  • Confirm API data loads without CORS errors
  • Refresh direct route URLs (for example /profile or /listing/123) to validate SPA fallback

docs.title: Blank Page After Deploy
docs.text:
• Check browser console for missing asset paths
  • Verify Vite base setting and deployment path
  • Confirm dist/assets/* files are uploaded

docs.title: CORS Error on API Calls
docs.text:
• Allow frontend domain in backend CORS config
  • Ensure preflight OPTIONS requests are handled

docs.title: 404 on Refresh (SPA Routes)
docs.text:
• Web server fallback rule is missing or incorrect
  • Re-check Nginx/Apache rewrite config

docs.title: Setup Web Application - Prerequisite
docs.text:
Before deploying the web application, ensure:

  • Admin/API backend is fully installed and reachable
  • Correct API base URL is available
  • Domain and SSL are ready for web frontend
  • React/Vite build environment (Node.js + npm) is installed

docs.title: Buyer Checklist
docs.text:
• [ ] Read web setup guide from CodeCanyon ZIP
  • [ ] Confirm API health endpoints are reachable
  • [ ] Confirm CORS and HTTPS policies are ready
